objects.description: Before encrypting the process, [EKANS](https://collaborate.mitre.org/attackics/index.php/Software/S0014) first kills the process if its name matches one of the processes defined on the kill-list.(Citation: FireEye Ransomware Against the Machine July 2020)(Citation: FireEye OT Ransomware July 2020) EKANS also utilizes netsh commands to implement firewall rules that blocks any remote communication with the device.(Citation: Fortinet EKANS July 2020)

external_references.source_name: FireEye Ransomware Against the Machine July 2020
external_references.description: Daniel Kapellmann Zafra, Keith Lunden, Nathan Brubaker, Jeremy Kennelly. (2020, July 15). Ransomware Against the Machine: How Adversaries are Learning to Disrupt Industrial Production by Targeting IT and OT. Retrieved April 12, 2021.

Nathan Brubaker, Daniel Kapellmann Zafra, Keith Lunden, Ken Proska, Corey Hildebrandt. (2020, July 15). Financially Motivated Actors Are Expanding Access Into OT: Analysis of Kill Lists That Include OT Processes Used With Seven Malware Families. Retrieved April 12, 2021.
Ben Hunter and Fred Gutierrez. (2020, July 01). EKANS Ransomware Targeting OT ICS Systems. Retrieved April 12, 2021.
